Guest Network Service

NOTICE:

The namespace prefix http://cisco.com/jnap/ has been deprecated but is still supported. All JNAP clients should switch to the new namespace prefix http://linksys.com/jnap/.

Change History

Revision Date Notes
5.0.0 2019-07-17 Added GuestNetwork5 service to indicate the following actions now require authentication:
  • GetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • GetGuestNetworkClients
4.0.1 2019-07-12 Consolidated Guest Network.

Services

GuestNetwork

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestNetwork
This service provides access to guest network settings on a wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetGuestNetworkSettings
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings

GuestNetwork2

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestNetwork2
This service provides access to guest network settings on a wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetGuestNetworkClients
  • GetGuestNetworkSettings
  • GetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings3

GuestNetwork3

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestNetwork3
This service provides access to guest network settings on a wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetGuestNetworkClients
  • GetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • GetGuestRadioSettings
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings3
  • SetGuestRadioSettings

GuestNetwork4

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestNetwork4
This service provides access to guest network settings on a wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetGuestNetworkClients
  • GetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • GetGuestRadioSettings
  • GetGuestRadioSettings2
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings3

GuestNetwork5

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestNetwork5
This service provides access to guest network settings on a wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetGuestNetworkClients
  • GetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • GetGuestRadioSettings2
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings2
  • SetGuestNetworkSettings3
  • SetGuestRadioSettings2

Actions

GetGuestNetworkClients

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkClients
This action gets information about the authorized clients on the guest network. Note that clients will only appear in this list for as long as they are authorized to be on the guest network.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
clients AuthorizedClient[] no The list of authorized clients.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkClientsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkClients"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "clients": [
      {
        "ipAddress": "192.168.1.101",
        "macAddress": "00:22:5F:A1:73:C1",
        "entryTime": "2016-07-23T14:30:59Z",
        "expiryTime": "2016-07-23T14:30:59Z"
      }
    ]
  }
}

GetGuestNetworkSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkSettings
This action gets the wireless access point's guest network settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isGuestNetworkEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature is currently enabled.
broadcastGuestSSID bool no Whether SSID broadcast for the guest network is currently enabled.
guestSSID string no The guest network SSID. The maximum length of this value is 32 bytes.
guestPassword string no The guest network password. Refer to the guestPasswordRestrictions member for specific restrictions placed on the guess network's password.
maxSimultaneousGuests int no The maximum number of users that are allowed on the guest network simultaneously.
canEnableGuestNetwork bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature can be enabled, given the wireless access point's current configuration. This information is necessary, for example, if the wireless access point is a dual-band router that only implements the guest network on one of its radios, and that radio is currently disabled. Note that this value will always be true when isGuestNetworkEnabled is true.
guestPasswordRestrictions GuestPasswordRestrictions no The restrictions that the wireless access point imposes on the guest password.
maxSimultaneousGuestsLimit int no The maximum value that the maxSimultaneousGuests parameter can ever be set to.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isGuestNetworkEnabled": true,
    "broadcastGuestSSID": true,
    "guestSSID": "HappyNet-guest",
    "guestPassword": "iamaGUEST!",
    "maxSimultaneousGuests": 4,
    "canEnableGuestNetwork": true,
    "guestPasswordRestrictions": {
      "minLength": 4,
      "maxLength": 32,
      "allowedCharacters": [
        {
          "lowCodepoint": 32,
          "highCodepoint": 126
        }
      ]
    },
    "maxSimultaneousGuestsLimit": 100
  }
}

GetGuestNetworkSettings2

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkSettings2
This action gets the wireless access point's guest network LAN settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
ipAddress IPAddress no The IP address of the gateway on the guest LAN. his is also the DHCP server's IP address.
networkPrefixLength int no The network prefix length of the guest LAN.
minNetworkPrefixLength int no The minimum supported network prefix length of the guest LAN.
maxNetworkPrefixLength int no The maximum supported network prefix length of the guest LAN.
minAllowedLeaseHours int no The minimum allowed length, in hours, of a guest lease.
maxAllowedLeaseHours int no The maximum allowed length, in hours, of a guest lease.
leaseHours int no The length, in hours, a guest is allowed on the guest LAN. This applies to both the guest's DHCP lease and the length of the guest's authorization to use the guest network.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkSettings2Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestNetworkSettings2"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "ipAddress": "192.168.3.1",
    "networkPrefixLength": 24,
    "minNetworkPrefixLength": 8,
    "maxNetworkPrefixLength": 30,
    "minAllowedLeaseHours": 123,
    "maxAllowedLeaseHours": 123,
    "leaseHours": 123
  }
}

GetGuestRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestRadioSettings
This action gets the wireless access point's guest network radio settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isGuestNetworkEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature should be enabled.
radios GuestRadioSettings[] no The list of settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.
maxSimultaneousGuests int no The maximum number of users that are allowed on the guest network simultaneously.
guestPasswordRestrictions GuestPasswordRestrictions no The restrictions that the wireless access point imposes on the guest password.
maxSimultaneousGuestsLimit int no The maximum value that the maxSimultaneousGuests parameter can ever be set to. This value corresponds to the total number of guests allowed on the guest network, not for each radio.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestRadioSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestRadioSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isGuestNetworkEnabled": true,
    "radios": [
      {
        "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
        "isEnabled": true,
        "broadcastGuestSSID": true,
        "guestSSID": "HappyNet-guest",
        "guestPassword": "iamaGUEST!",
        "canEnableRadio": true
      }
    ],
    "maxSimultaneousGuests": 4,
    "guestPasswordRestrictions": {
      "minLength": 4,
      "maxLength": 32,
      "allowedCharacters": [
        {
          "lowCodepoint": 32,
          "highCodepoint": 126
        }
      ]
    },
    "maxSimultaneousGuestsLimit": 100
  }
}

GetGuestRadioSettings2

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestRadioSettings2
This action gets the wireless access point's guest network radio settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal bool no Whether the guest acces wireless network is using a captive portal.
isGuestNetworkEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature should be enabled.
radios GuestRadioSettings2[] no The list of settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.
maxSimultaneousGuests int yes The maximum number of users that are allowed on the guest network simultaneously. This value is returned only when isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is true.
guestPasswordRestrictions GuestPasswordRestrictions yes The restrictions that the wireless access point imposes on the guest password.
maxSimultaneousGuestsLimit int yes The maximum value that the maxSimultaneousGuests parameter can ever be set to. This value corresponds to the total number of guests allowed on the guest network, not for each radio. This value is returned only when isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is true.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestRadioSettings2Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GetGuestRadioSettings2"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal": true,
    "isGuestNetworkEnabled": true,
    "radios": [
      {
        "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
        "isEnabled": true,
        "broadcastGuestSSID": true,
        "guestSSID": "HappyNet-guest",
        "guestPassword": "iamaGUEST!",
        "guestWPAPassphrase": "iamaWPAPassphrase!",
        "canEnableRadio": true
      }
    ],
    "maxSimultaneousGuests": 4,
    "guestPasswordRestrictions": {
      "minLength": 4,
      "maxLength": 32,
      "allowedCharacters": [
        {
          "lowCodepoint": 32,
          "highCodepoint": 126
        }
      ]
    },
    "maxSimultaneousGuestsLimit": 100
  }
}

SetGuestNetworkSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings
This action sets the wireless access point's guest network settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isGuestNetworkEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature should be enabled.
broadcastGuestSSID bool no Whether SSID broadcast for the guest network should be enabled.
guestSSID string no The new guest network SSID.
guestPassword string no The new guest network password.
maxSimultaneousGuests int no The new maximum number of users that should be allowed on the guest network simultaneously.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorCannotEnableGuestNetwork The guest network feature cannot be enabled due to the current configuration of the wireless access point. Clients should invoke the GetGuestNetworkSettings action and verify that the canEnableGuestNetwork output parameter is true before trying to enable the guest network.
ErrorGuestSSIDConflict The specified guest network SSID conflicts with another SSID on the wireless access point.
ErrorInvalidGuestPassword The specified guest network password is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidGuestSSID The specified guest network SSID is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidMaxSimultaneousGuests The specified maximum number of simultaneous guests is less than 1, or greater than the maximum allowed.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings"

{
  "isGuestNetworkEnabled": true,
  "broadcastGuestSSID": true,
  "guestSSID": "HappyNet-guest",
  "guestPassword": "iamaGUEST!",
  "maxSimultaneousGuests": 4
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetGuestNetworkSettings2

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings2
This action sets the wireless access point's guest network LAN settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
ipAddress IPAddress no The desired IP address of the gateway on the guest LAN.
The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the guest LAN host address. The guest LAN host address must not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
0.0.0.0/8 "This" Network RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
127.0.0.0/8 Loopback RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
169.254.0.0/16 Link Local RFC 3927
224.0.0.0/4 Multicast RFC 3171
240.0.0.0/4 Reserved for Future Use RFC 1112, Section 4
255.255.255.255/32 Limited Broadcast RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0 Subnetwork ID RFC 922, Section 7
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255 Subnetwork Broadcast Address RFC 922, Section 7
Additionally it must not conflict with the LAN subnetwork as returned by http://linksys.com/jnap/router/GetLANSettings.
networkPrefixLength int no The desired network prefix length of the guest LAN. This value must be between the minNetworkPrefixLength and maxNetworkPrefixLength values returned by GetGuestNetworkSettings2.
leaseHours int no The length, in hours, a guest is allowed on the guest LAN. This applies to both the guest's DHCP lease and the length of the guest's authorization to use the guest network.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings2Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorInvalidIPAddress The specified router IP address is not valid.
ErrorInvalidLeaseLength The specified guest lease length is outside the allowed range.
ErrorInvalidNetworkPrefixLength The specified network prefix is invalid or is not supported by the router.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings2"

{
  "ipAddress": "192.0.2.1",
  "networkPrefixLength": 24,
  "leaseHours": 123
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetGuestNetworkSettings3

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings3
This action sets the wireless access point's guest network settings and restart wifi guest.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isGuestNetworkEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature should be enabled.
broadcastGuestSSID bool no Whether SSID broadcast for the guest network should be enabled.
guestSSID string no The new guest network SSID.
guestPassword string no The new guest network password.
maxSimultaneousGuests int no The new maximum number of users that should be allowed on the guest network simultaneously.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings3Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorCannotEnableGuestNetwork The guest network feature cannot be enabled due to the current configuration of the wireless access point. Clients should invoke the GetGuestNetworkSettings action and verify that the canEnableGuestNetwork output parameter is true before trying to enable the guest network.
ErrorGuestSSIDConflict The specified guest network SSID conflicts with another SSID on the wireless access point.
ErrorInvalidGuestPassword The specified guest network password is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidGuestSSID The specified guest network SSID is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidMaxSimultaneousGuests The specified maximum number of simultaneous guests is less than 1, or greater than the maximum allowed.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestNetworkSettings3"

{
  "isGuestNetworkEnabled": true,
  "broadcastGuestSSID": true,
  "guestSSID": "HappyNet-guest",
  "guestPassword": "iamaGUEST!",
  "maxSimultaneousGuests": 4
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetGuestRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestRadioSettings
This action sets information and settings for one or more of the wireless access point's guest network.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isGuestNetworkEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature should be enabled.
radios GuestRadioSettings[] no The list of settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.
maxSimultaneousGuests int no The new maximum number of users that should be allowed on the guest network simultaneously.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestRadioSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorCannotEnableGuestNetwork The guest network feature cannot be enabled due to the current configuration of the wireless access point. Clients should invoke the GetGuestNetworkSettings action and verify that the canEnableGuestNetwork output parameter is true before trying to enable the guest network.
ErrorGuestSSIDConflict The specified guest network SSID conflicts with another SSID on the wireless access point.
ErrorInvalidGuestPassword The specified guest network password is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidGuestSSID The specified guest network SSID is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidMaxSimultaneousGuests The specified maximum number of simultaneous guests is less than 1, or greater than the maximum allowed.
ErrorUnknownRadio One of the specified radio IDs does not correspond to an actual radio in the access point.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestRadioSettings"

{
  "isGuestNetworkEnabled": true,
  "radios": [
    {
      "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
      "isEnabled": true,
      "broadcastGuestSSID": true,
      "guestSSID": "HappyNet-guest",
      "guestPassword": "iamaGUEST!",
      "canEnableRadio": true
    }
  ],
  "maxSimultaneousGuests": 4
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetGuestRadioSettings2

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestRadioSettings2
This action sets information and settings for one or more of the wireless access point's guest network.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isGuestNetworkEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network feature should be enabled.
radios GuestRadioSettings2[] no The list of settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.
maxSimultaneousGuests int yes The new maximum number of users that should be allowed on the guest network simultaneously. This is only required when isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is true. Otherwise, it's a no-op.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestRadioSettings2Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorCannotEnableGuestNetwork The guest network feature cannot be enabled due to the current configuration of the wireless access point. Clients should invoke the GetGuestNetworkSettings action and verify that the canEnableGuestNetwork output parameter is true before trying to enable the guest network.
ErrorGuestSSIDConflict The specified guest network SSID conflicts with another SSID on the wireless access point.
ErrorInvalidGuestPassword The specified guest network password is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidGuestSSID The specified guest network SSID is too short, too long, or contains characters that are not allowed.
ErrorInvalidMaxSimultaneousGuests The specified maximum number of simultaneous guests is less than 1, or greater than the maximum allowed.
ErrorMissingGuestPassword isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is true, therefore guest password is required.
ErrorMissingGuestWPAPasphrase isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is false, therefore guest WPA pasphrase is required.
ErrorMissingMaxSimultaneousGuests isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is true, therefore maxSimultaneousGuests is required.
ErrorSuperfluousGuestPassword Guest password is specified although isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is false.
ErrorSuperfluousGuestWPAPasphrase Guest WPA passphrase is specified although isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is true.
ErrorSuperfluousMaxSimultaneousGuests Maximum number of simultaneous guests is specified although isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is false.
ErrorUnknownRadio One of the specified radio IDs does not correspond to an actual radio in the access point.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/SetGuestRadioSettings2"

{
  "isGuestNetworkEnabled": true,
  "radios": [
    {
      "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
      "isEnabled": true,
      "broadcastGuestSSID": true,
      "guestSSID": "HappyNet-guest",
      "guestPassword": "iamaGUEST!",
      "guestWPAPassphrase": "iamaWPAPassphrase!",
      "canEnableRadio": true
    }
  ],
  "maxSimultaneousGuests": 4
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

Structures

AuthorizedClient

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/AuthorizedClient
A guest network authorized client.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
ipAddress IPAddress no The IP address of the authorized client.
macAddress MACAddress no The MAC address of the authorized client.
entryTime DateTime no The time the client's authorization window opened.
expiryTime DateTime no The time the client's authorization window closes.

GuestPasswordRestrictions

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestPasswordRestrictions
This service provides access to guest network settings on a wireless access point. Restrictions that the wireless access point imposes on guest passwords.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
minLength int no The minimum length of the guest password, in bytes.
maxLength int no The maximum length of the guest password, in bytes.
allowedCharacters UnicodeRange[] no A list of Unicode codepoint ranges, the union of which represents the complete set of characters that are allowed in the guest password. This array will always contain at least one item.

GuestRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestRadioSettings
Settings for a guest wireless radio.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio.
isEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network radio is enabled.
broadcastGuestSSID bool no Whether SSID broadcast for the guest network is enabled.
guestSSID string no The guest network SSID.
guestPassword string no The guest network password.
canEnableRadio bool yes Whether the wireless access point's guest network radio can be enabled, given the wireless access point's current configuration. This information is necessary, for example, if the wireless access point is a dual-band router that only implements the guest network on one of its radios, and that radio is currently disabled. This value is ignored when used in the context of SetGuestRadioSettings.

GuestRadioSettings2

http://linksys.com/jnap/guestnetwork/GuestRadioSettings2
Settings for a guest wireless radio.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio.
isEnabled bool no Whether the wireless access point's guest network radio is enabled.
broadcastGuestSSID bool no Whether SSID broadcast for the guest network is enabled.
guestSSID string no The guest network SSID.
guestPassword string yes The guest network password. This only exists when isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is true.
guestWPAPassphrase string yes The guest network WPA passphrase. This value must either be a 8-63 characters in the range U+0032 - U+007E (printable ASCII) or exactly 64 ASCII hexadecimal digits. This only exists when isGuestNetworkACaptivePortal is false.
canEnableRadio bool yes Whether the wireless access point's guest network radio can be enabled, given the wireless access point's current configuration. This information is necessary, for example, if the wireless access point is a dual-band router that only implements the guest network on one of its radios, and that radio is currently disabled. This value is ignored when used in the context of SetGuestRadioSettings.

UnicodeRange

http://linksys.com/jnap/unicode/UnicodeRange
Enumerations and structures related to Unicode. This structure represents a range of Unicode codepoints.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
lowCodepoint int no The lowest Unicode codepoint in the range.
highCodepoint int no The highest Unicode codepoint in the range.
